userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Don't ignore your body. Ask for help even if you don't want to.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?

condition.description:
If you have lupus, your immune system attacks healthy cells and tissues by mistake. This can damage your joints, skin, blood vessels and organs. There are many kinds of lupus. The most common type, systemic lupus erythematosus, affects many parts of the body. Discoid lupus causes a rash that doesn't go away. Subacute cutaneous lupus causes sores after being out in the sun. Another type can be caused by medication. Neonatal lupus, which is rare, affects newborns.

Anyone can get lupus, but women are most at risk. Lupus is also more common in African American, Hispanic, Asian and Native American women. The cause of lupus is not known.

Lupus has many symptoms. Some common ones are

  • Joint pain or swelling
  • Muscle pain
  • Fever with no known cause
  • Fatigue
  • Red rashes, often on the face (also called the "butterfly rash")

There is no one test to diagnose lupus, and it may take months or years to make the diagnosis. There is no cure for lupus, but medicines and lifestyle changes can help control it.

NIH: National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases
condition.name: Lupus
symptoms: Red rashes, often on the face (called a "butterfly rash")

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

upsides_processed.orig: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves pain, fever, and inflammation. Protects your heart and thins blood.

userStories.tip: research and understand the actual reason to take this medicine, as well as any medicine - than it will be helpful. Don't take it "just because". High quality Aspirin (e.g. Bayer) is much better (better effect without harming)

drugs.name: Aspirin

off-label_indications.indication: Blood clot prevention for blood vessel graft
Blood clot prevention for atrial fibrillation
Blood clot prevention for artificial heart valve
Blood clot prevention for peripheral artery disease
High blood pressure prevention for IVF pregnancy

carousel_items_processed.orig: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: You can crush the tablets and take Hydrocortisone with your food or drink. Do not open up a capsule, since they need to be swallowed whole.
Be sure not to stop taking Hydrocortisone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Some people gain weight while taking Hydrocortisone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydrocortisone is a short-acting corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation by preventing your capillaries (small blood vessels) from leaking out excess fluid and chemicals that cause swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Hydrocortisone is identical to an essential hormone that humans produce and has been proven to work safely.
downsides: In the first few weeks, your doctor might adjust the dose of Hydrocortisone multiple times.
You may be at an increased risk of infection if you take high doses of Hydrocortisone, or if you take it in combination with other immunosuppressive medications.
Your body could stop making its own cortisol once it gets used to Hydrocortisone. If so, you'll likely have to keep taking Hydrocortisone for a really long time.
Depending on why your doctor prescribed Hydrocortisone to you, corticosteroids can have different effects on your body.

downsides_processed.orig: In the first few weeks, your doctor might adjust the dose of Hydrocortisone multiple times.
You may be at an increased risk of infection if you take high doses of Hydrocortisone, or if you take it in combination with other immunosuppressive medications.
Your body could stop making its own cortisol once it gets used to Hydrocortisone. If so, you'll likely have to keep taking Hydrocortisone for a really long time.
Depending on why your doctor prescribed Hydrocortisone to you, corticosteroids can have different effects on your body.

upsides: Normal doses of hydrocortisone have been safely and successfully used for over 60 years. It's especially good for people using it as a long-term cortisol supplement.
Hydrocortisone converts into cortisol, a natural hormone, which will not interfere with other medications you may be taking.
Taking a dose of Hydrocortisone in the evening doesn't affect your ability to sleep.
At safe doses, Hydrocortisone can actually increase your body's ability to fight infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Normal doses of hydrocortisone have been safely and successfully used for over 60 years. It's especially good for people using it as a long-term cortisol supplement.
Hydrocortisone converts into cortisol, a natural hormone, which will not interfere with other medications you may be taking.
Taking a dose of Hydrocortisone in the evening doesn't affect your ability to sleep.
At safe doses, Hydrocortisone can actually increase your body's ability to fight infection.

drugs.one_liner: Hydrocortisone lowers inflammation, suppresses the immune system, and replaces low cortisol.
drugs.name: Cortef

off-label_indications.indication: Nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy

carousel_items_processed.orig: You can crush the tablets and take Hydrocortisone with your food or drink. Do not open up a capsule, since they need to be swallowed whole.
Be sure not to stop taking Hydrocortisone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Some people gain weight while taking Hydrocortisone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Hydrocortisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Hydrocortisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Hydrocortisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Hydrocortisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Hydrocortisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Hydrocortisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Hydrocortisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Hydrocortisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Hydrocortisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Hydrocortisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Hydrocortisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Hydrocortisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Hydrocortisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Hydrocortisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Hydrocortisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Hydrocortisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Hydrocortisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Hydrocortisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Hydrocortisone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

description_processed.orig: Taking Hydrocortisone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Hydrocortisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Hydrocortisone with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Hydrocortisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

carousel_items: Don’t give up on Plaquenil, it can take 2-4 months to take effect.
Take Plaquenil with milk to help decrease nausea.
If you have difficulty swallowing Plaquenil, you can crush it, and mix it in jam or jelly.

While taking Plaquenil it is important to wear sunglasses in bright light to protect your eyes from damage. When you can’t avoid sunlight, be sure to use sunscreen, put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, and a hat.
Stay away from alcohol while taking Plaquenil.
Certain medications can interact with Plaquenil, so to be safe, tell your doctor about other medications and supplements you may be taking.

basics.benefits_moa: Plaquenil is called a DMARD, a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug. It prevents your body from activating cells that cause inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Plaquenil is a great medication for rheumatoid arthritis and comes with less side effects than other DMARDs.
downsides: You will likely have to take additional medications like Methotrexate to keep your RA in control.
In some people, small particles develop in the eyes, so you’ll have to get your eyes checked once per year.
It can take up to 6 months before the full benefits of Plaquenil are felt.
Many people have nausea, stomach cramps, and diarrhea when they first start taking Plaquenil.

downsides_processed.orig: You will likely have to take additional medications like Methotrexate to keep your RA in control.
In some people, small particles develop in the eyes, so you’ll have to get your eyes checked once per year.
It can take up to 6 months before the full benefits of Plaquenil are felt.
Many people have nausea, stomach cramps, and diarrhea when they first start taking Plaquenil.

upsides: Plaquenil has been shown to improve physical function in up to 80% of patients.
Plaquenil and similar DMARD medications help minimize joint damage, decrease symptoms and lessen future complications.
Plaquenil is an excellent choice for people who have difficulty tolerating newer biologic medications.
A generic form of Plaquenil is available.

upsides_processed.orig: Plaquenil has been shown to improve physical function in up to 80% of patients.
Plaquenil and similar DMARD medications help minimize joint damage, decrease symptoms and lessen future complications.
Plaquenil is an excellent choice for people who have difficulty tolerating newer biologic medications.
A generic form of Plaquenil is available.

drugs.one_liner: Improves inflammatory conditions like rheumatoid arthritis.

userStories.tip: Eye checkups important....important to stay on daily regimen if for lupus
Take Plaquenil not Quinoric
get regular checkups with eye doctor, get regular bloodwork
Take after food. Get regular eye tests.Has stabilized my lupus and antibody levels have gone down.

drugs.name: Plaquenil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don’t give up on Plaquenil, it can take 2-4 months to take effect.
Take Plaquenil with milk to help decrease nausea.
If you have difficulty swallowing Plaquenil, you can crush it, and mix it in jam or jelly.

While taking Plaquenil it is important to wear sunglasses in bright light to protect your eyes from damage. When you can’t avoid sunlight, be sure to use sunscreen, put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, and a hat.
Stay away from alcohol while taking Plaquenil.
Certain medications can interact with Plaquenil, so to be safe, tell your doctor about other medications and supplements you may be taking.

risks_warnings.title: Prescribing Information
risks_warnings.description: Doctors should be completely familiar with the medication label before prescribing Plaquenil.

description_processed.orig: Doctors should be completely familiar with the medication label before prescribing Plaquenil.

risks_warnings.title: Drug resistance
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil is not effective against chloroquine-resistant strains of P. falciparum malaria.

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil is not effective against chloroquine-resistant strains of P. falciparum malaria.

risks_warnings.title: Children
risks_warnings.description: Children are especially sensitive to medications like Plaquenil, which contain 4-aminoquinoline. Ingestion of small amounts has caused death in children. So to be safe, keep Plaquenil out of the reach of children.

description_processed.orig: Children are especially sensitive to medications like Plaquenil, which contain 4-aminoquinoline. Ingestion of small amounts has caused death in children. So to be safe, keep Plaquenil out of the reach of children.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil should only be used in pregnancy for malaria when using it outweighs its harmful effects. The IV form of Plaquenil has been shown to cross the placenta rapidly and can harm the baby.

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil should only be used in pregnancy for malaria when using it outweighs its harmful effects. The IV form of Plaquenil has been shown to cross the placenta rapidly and can harm the baby.

risks_warnings.title: Damage to retina of eye
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil can cause blurred vision, difficulty reading, and damage to the retina of the eye during or after long-term treatment. The chance of this happening is less with lower doses. Before starting treatment, your doctor may send you to an ophthalmologist (eye doctor) to carefully examine both eyes. This should be repeated at least once a year. If you have trouble seeing color or clearly, call your doctor and stop taking Plaquenil. These effects may last even after stopping the medicine.
risk_factors: Taking Plaquenil in higher than recommended doses

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil can cause blurred vision, difficulty reading, and damage to the retina of the eye during or after long-term treatment. The chance of this happening is less with lower doses. Before starting treatment, your doctor may send you to an ophthalmologist (eye doctor) to carefully examine both eyes. This should be repeated at least once a year. If you have trouble seeing color or clearly, call your doctor and stop taking Plaquenil. These effects may last even after stopping the medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

carousel_items: Be sure to take Prednisolone in the morning to help imitate your bodies release of cortisol. This will also help you sleep better at night.
You can crush the tablets and take Prednisolone with your food or drink. Do not open up a capsule, they need to be swallowed whole.
Be sure not to stop taking Prednisolone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Stay away from people who are sick because Prednisolone can make lower your bodies ability to fight infection.
Many people gain weight while taking Prednisolone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.
Avoid direct sunlight while taking this medication. When you can’t avoid it, be sure to use sunscreen. It’s also important to put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisolone is an intermediate-acting synthetic corticosteroid. Researchers are not sure exactly sure how it decreases inflammation, but it seems to block the proteins that trigger inflammation. It also seems to affect the hormones used in balance our water and break carbohydrates down.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisolone and similar anti-inflammatory medications work great, but you have to be willing to deal with a list of side effects.
downsides: You will probably have to take additional medications in order to treat your condition.

Prednisolone and similar corticosteroids come with lots of side effects including an including an increased appetite, irritability, swelling of the ankles and feet, increased blood sugar, and decreased healing.
Taking Prednisolone as a long-term medication may lead to permanent side effects.
You must have blood tests often while taking Prednisolone to make sure your body is processing it correctly.
You can’t be around others who are sick, conceive a child, or get vaccinations while taking Prednisolone.

downsides_processed.orig: You will probably have to take additional medications in order to treat your condition.

Prednisolone and similar corticosteroids come with lots of side effects including an including an increased appetite, irritability, swelling of the ankles and feet, increased blood sugar, and decreased healing.
Taking Prednisolone as a long-term medication may lead to permanent side effects.
You must have blood tests often while taking Prednisolone to make sure your body is processing it correctly.
You can’t be around others who are sick, conceive a child, or get vaccinations while taking Prednisolone.

upsides: While Prednisolone is used for several conditions, and in combination with other medications, in one study Prednisolone was 96.6% successful in reducing the symptoms of an autoimmune condition.
You probably won’t have to take Prednisolone very long because it decreases inflammation, and reduces pain rather quickly.
Depending on how long you take Prednisolone, most of its side effects go away after you stop taking it.
Prednisolone comes in several forms, including a dissolvable tablet.
taking Prednisolone or other glucocorticoids gives the body energy to help fight the stress caused by bleeding, trauma, infection, or disease.

risks_warnings.title: Eye Problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisolone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye. Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Prednisolone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye. Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Heart and Kidney Problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking large doses of Prednisolone can cause high blood pressure, water retention and an imbalance of your electrolytes. Your doctor may advise you restrict salt intake, and take calcium supplements.

description_processed.orig: Taking large doses of Prednisolone can cause high blood pressure, water retention and an imbalance of your electrolytes. Your doctor may advise you restrict salt intake, and take calcium supplements.

risks_warnings.title: adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisolone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisolone need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop your medication.

You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisolone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

carousel_items: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Indomethacin is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Indomethacin works well for mild to moderate pain and swelling, but it shouldn't be used long-term since it has some serious side effects.
downsides: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

upsides: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

userStories.tip: They aren't judging when they say it can make you suck to your stomach. Spent the night on the bathroom floor a couple hours after taking it.
always take with food

drugs.name: Indocin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding or bruising
risks_warnings.description: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

carousel_items: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Naproxen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Naproxen works well for mild to moderate pain and inflammation, and it lasts longer than other NSAIDs.
downsides: It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen, so you can take it less often.
Naproxen works as well as Aspirin and Indomethacin to treat arthritis pain, and causes fewer stomach problems.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen, so you can take it less often.
Naproxen works as well as Aspirin and Indomethacin to treat arthritis pain, and causes fewer stomach problems.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

userStories.tip: Was prescribed naproxen for shoulder pain and inflammation, twice a day for 10 days. Pain disappeared almost immediately. No discernible side effects. Hoping the effects will be long lasting after stopping the medication.
It takes about a day to kick in.
definitely take with food.
I take it occasionally for back pain.

Naproxen was great the first time I used it for a few weeks. But I unknowingly developed an allergy to it, so the next time I took it 6 months later, I broke out in hives and my face swelled up like a balloon. So I can't take it anymore.

drugs.name: Naproxen

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Naproxen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Naproxen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Naproxen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Naproxen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Naproxen. Don't take Naproxen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Naproxen.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Naproxen. Don't take Naproxen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Naproxen.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Naproxen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Naproxen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Lower kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Naproxen for any amount of time.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Naproxen for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

carousel_items: Rituximab is given as an IV infusion by trained medical staff in a clinic or hospital.
You'll need to be monitored in the clinic in case you have a serious or life-threatening reaction during the infusion, but you can take other medications that'll lower your risk of this happening.
It's very important that you read the Medication Guide before you start taking Rituximab.
Rituximab lowers your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you notice a fever, a cough that doesn't go away, or flu-like symptoms.
Use effective birth control while you're taking Rituximab and for 12 months after you finish treatment.
Don't get live vaccines while you're taking Rituximab.

basics.benefits_moa: Rituximab is a monoclonal antibody. It targets a specific protein on white blood cells that makes it easier for your immune system to find and destroy cancerous cells. It also relieves symptoms and slows the progression of Rheumatoid Arthritis.
basics.bottom_line: Rituximab is effective for treating multiple types of cancer and arthritis. That said, you'll need to watch for possibly serious side effects, especially infusion reactions.
downsides: Only your doctor or other trained medical staff can administer Rituximab, so you'll need to go into an office or clinic for every dose.
Not the best choice if you have heart problems.
Rituximab can stay in your body for up to 6 months after you complete treatment. Men and women who are able to have children need to use birth control for up to one year after finishing Rituximab.
Discuss with your doctor the serious heart, kidney, liver, or stomach problems that can happen while on Rituximab.

downsides_processed.orig: Only your doctor or other trained medical staff can administer Rituximab, so you'll need to go into an office or clinic for every dose.
Not the best choice if you have heart problems.
Rituximab can stay in your body for up to 6 months after you complete treatment. Men and women who are able to have children need to use birth control for up to one year after finishing Rituximab.
Discuss with your doctor the serious heart, kidney, liver, or stomach problems that can happen while on Rituximab.

upsides: Treats leukemia, lymphoma, and blood vessel inflammation.
Also treats moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis that hasn't responded to anti-TNF treatment (but you'll need to take methotrexate too).

The chance of having a reaction to the infusion is highest during your first dose, but the risk decreases each time you get Rituximab. It usually happens within 30 minutes to 2 hours after starting the infusion.
Rituximab is a targeted therapy that works differently than chemotherapy. Both work well when they're taken together, especially when treating CLL and NHL.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats leukemia, lymphoma, and blood vessel inflammation.
Also treats moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis that hasn't responded to anti-TNF treatment (but you'll need to take methotrexate too).

The chance of having a reaction to the infusion is highest during your first dose, but the risk decreases each time you get Rituximab. It usually happens within 30 minutes to 2 hours after starting the infusion.
Rituximab is a targeted therapy that works differently than chemotherapy. Both work well when they're taken together, especially when treating CLL and NHL.

drugs.name: Rituxan

carousel_items_processed.orig: Rituximab is given as an IV infusion by trained medical staff in a clinic or hospital.
You'll need to be monitored in the clinic in case you have a serious or life-threatening reaction during the infusion, but you can take other medications that'll lower your risk of this happening.
It's very important that you read the Medication Guide before you start taking Rituximab.
Rituximab lowers your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you notice a fever, a cough that doesn't go away, or flu-like symptoms.
Use effective birth control while you're taking Rituximab and for 12 months after you finish treatment.
Don't get live vaccines while you're taking Rituximab.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Serious infusion reactions can occur at the time Rituximab is given and within 24 hours. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if  you notice itching, sudden cough, dizziness, racing heartbeat, chest pain, or  angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Your doctor can prescribe medication before your dose so the risk of having this happen is less.

description_processed.orig: Serious infusion reactions can occur at the time Rituximab is given and within 24 hours. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if  you notice itching, sudden cough, dizziness, racing heartbeat, chest pain, or  angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Your doctor can prescribe medication before your dose so the risk of having this happen is less.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Rituximab can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections including sepsis. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Rituximab. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Rituximab can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections including sepsis. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Rituximab. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Nervous system effects
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Rituximab can cause Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML), a serious often fatal brain infection caused by a virus. Unfortunately, it can't be prevented or treated, and if you get it, there's no cure. Let your doctor know right away if you become confused, dizzy, have vision problems, loss of balance or weakness on one side of your body
risk_factors: Taking Rituximab with immunosuppressant drugs (if using for RA)
Taking Rituximab with chemotherapy (if using for NHL or CLL

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Rituximab can cause Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML), a serious often fatal brain infection caused by a virus. Unfortunately, it can't be prevented or treated, and if you get it, there's no cure. Let your doctor know right away if you become confused, dizzy, have vision problems, loss of balance or weakness on one side of your body

risks_warnings.title: Skin and mouth reactions
risks_warnings.description: Severe and possibly fatal reactions (e.g. Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, pemphigus)  can happen anytime and as early as the first day while taking Rituximab. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you notice sores or fluid-filled blisters on your skin, lips or inside your mouth or peeling skin that's painful. You may not be able to re-start Rituximab after this reaction.

description_processed.orig: Severe and possibly fatal reactions (e.g. Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, pemphigus)  can happen anytime and as early as the first day while taking Rituximab. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you notice sores or fluid-filled blisters on your skin, lips or inside your mouth or peeling skin that's painful. You may not be able to re-start Rituximab after this reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney injury
risks_warnings.description: Tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) happens when cancer cells are broken down very quickly and damage the kidneys. The damage can be so bad that people need dialysis. If you're taking Rituximab for a cancer condition your doctor can give you medicines and take measures to prevent this reaction.

description_processed.orig: Tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) happens when cancer cells are broken down very quickly and damage the kidneys. The damage can be so bad that people need dialysis. If you're taking Rituximab for a cancer condition your doctor can give you medicines and take measures to prevent this reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Rituximab can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If  the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Rituximab.

description_processed.orig: Rituximab can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If  the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Rituximab.

risks_warnings.title: Gastrointestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Blockage or tearing of the bowel can happen early on (average is within 6 days) while taking Rituximab. If you develop belly pain with or without repeated vomiting, tell your doctor and get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Blockage or tearing of the bowel can happen early on (average is within 6 days) while taking Rituximab. If you develop belly pain with or without repeated vomiting, tell your doctor and get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Blood problems
risks_warnings.description: Rituximab can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

description_processed.orig: Rituximab can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Don't ignore your body. Ask for help even if you don't want to.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Avoiding stress, swimming, always wake up and smile, even when you hurt so bad you need to smile

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Don't panic!! Read, read and read more about lupus, ask questions,

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Work with your doctor to understand the causes of your symptoms so you can give yourself the care you need

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Sleep, moderate exercise, avoiding sugar and refined carbs

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
